snippet: The U.S. Open stands out in tennis for the raucousness of its crowds and many top players say their experience at the event makes them willing to consider abandoning the sport’s tradition of muting spectators.
abstract: United States Open stands out in tennis for its raucous crowds and many top players say their experience at the event makes them willing to consider abandoning sport’s tradition of muting spectators.
lead_paragraph: The U.S. Open stands out in tennis for the raucousness of its crowds and many top players say their experience at the event makes them willing to consider abandoning the sport’s tradition of muting spectators.

headline.seo: Silenced at Wimbledon, Crowds Make the U.S. Open Unique
headline.main: Tennis Weighs Whether to Bring On the Noise
headline.print_headline: Bring On the Noise! Bring On the Hush.
